# Create an icon

[back](../readme.md)

To add a custom icon to the plugin widget you should locate the [BubleUp.xml](../CustomWidgets/bubbleUp/src/BubbleUp.xml) file in the src folder in the bubbleUp widget

This xml file has an entry for the icon, that is not set by default. When you want to add your own icon, it should be filled with an icon image. You can do this by including a base64 representation of the icon image. So suppose we would like to include the following icon:

![alt text](../resources/bubbleicon.png "Localhost 3000")

first step is to convert the icon image to a base64 representation with [Base64Guru]([BubleUp.xml](../CustomWidgets/bubbleUp/src/BubbleUp.xml)). Upload the icon and copy the text it gives you:

``` 

```

place this text into [BubleUp.xml](../CustomWidgets/bubbleUp/src/BubbleUp.xml) like this:

```xml
<description>Create a bubble arround any type off widget</description>
    <icon>iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAQAAAAEACAYAAABccqhmAAAA... </icon>
    <properties>
        <propertyGroup caption="General">
            <property key="sampleText" type="string" required="false">
                <caption>Default value</caption>
                <description>Sample text input</description>
            </property>
        </propertyGroup>
    </properties>
```

Save the xml file, go to studio pro, sync the project directory, this should change the icon to the one specified.

[back](../readme.md)
